required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate ARV-766 in Patients With Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Open-Label, Dose-Escalation Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of ARV-766 in Patients With Metastatic Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of ARV-766 in men with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will evaluate ARV-766 given once or twice daily to cohorts of patients in escalating doses. Each dose level will have safety assessed and if found safe and tolerable, the next cohort of patients will be enrolled at a higher dose level. Increasing dose levels will be evaluated until the highest safe dose is identified. Patients treated at lower doses may increase to the next higher dose level once it is determined to be safe, provided they have been on their current dose for 28 or more days and have no major side effects.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subsequent dose level is determined by the Cohort Review Committee after the initial starting dose cohort and each subsequent dose cohort completes the first 28 days of treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Dose Limiting Toxicities of ARV-766
primary_outcome.description: First Cycle Dose limiting toxicities characterized by type, frequency, severity (as graded by NCI CTCAE v 5.0), timing, seriousness, and relationship to study drug

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Adverse Events as a measure of safety and tolerability of ARV-766
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events as characterized by type, frequency, severity (as graded by NCI CTCAE v 5.0), timing, seriousness, and relationship to study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of laboratory abnormalities as a measure of safety and tolerability of ARV-766
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory abnormalities as characterized by type, frequency, severity (as graded by NCI CTCAE v 5.0), and timing.

arm_group.description: Oral tablet(s), once or twice daily in 28 day cycles

intervention.description: Daily dosages are determined by cohort review committee after initial starting dose cohort and each subsequent cohort completes 28 days of treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histological, pathological, or cytological confirmed diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the prostate.
- Progression on at least 2 prior approved systemic therapies for metastatic prostate cancer (at least one must be a second-generation androgen inhibitor, e.g., abiraterone, enzalutamide, darolutamide, apalutamide).
- Progressive mCRPC
- Ongoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) with a gonadotropin releasing hormone analog or inhibitor, or orchiectomy (surgical or medical castration).
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 or 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known symptomatic brain metastases requiring steroids (above physiologic replacement doses).
- Active inflammatory gastrointestinal disease, chronic diarrhea, known diverticular disease, or previous gastric resection or lap band surgery.
- Radiation therapy within 4 weeks of first dose of study drug or prior irradiation to >25% of the bone marrow.
- Receipt of an investigational drug(s) within 4 weeks prior to anticipated first dose
